text: There were two other sources of public revenue -first, the Church, which wisely followed the lead of the Commons and in its own Convocations granted equivalent contributions, and second, the foreign merchants, with whom the King's officials had formerly made private bargains at 'colloquies of merchants', and whose payments were now authorized by parliamentary sanction at a rate roughly fifty per cent in excess of the rate for native merchants.
handwritten_text: There were two other sources of public revenue -first, the Church, which wisely followed the lead of the Commons and in its own Convocations granted equivalent contributions, and second, the foreign merchants, with whom the King's officials had formerly made private bargains at 'colloquies of merchants', and whose payments were now authorized by parliamentary sanction at a rate roughly fifty per cent in excess of the rate for native merchants.
